answers.answer: Hello,there could be reasons other than thyroid for slow healing.  In particular you may want to ask your Dr. to screen for diabetes, which often goes hand in hand with thyroid and which can cause slow healing.

Thanks for your opinion!My dad is diabetic. So I'm sure I could actually just run a blood sugar test if I wanted to.I didn't realize that they were really related. That kind of worries me now. I just figured if that were ever to come around, I would know for sure from certain symptoms. I guess I will get that checked out ASAP.

question: I forgot to ask my doctor when I was there last week, but I'll be seeing him again soon to get my blood drawn to see my new TSH levels.I'm curious if hypothyroidism and a slow healing process have anything related. I've always felt like I've healed slower than the average person, but I hadn't realized how tired I was all the time until my freshman year of college, I'm now going to be a junior. My brother seems like he will have a cut/scrape and it will heal within a few days to a week, whereas if I were to have a cut/scrape it might not heal for weeks to a month. It's rather frustrating.I just wanted some opinions because I was thinking about getting a tattoo, but I don't know how the healing process would be...Thanks!
title: Hypothyroidism and slow healing related?
